render.tex: \title{Scalar (Dot) Product} \\ %text Scalar multiplication of two vectors %

reason.tex: %text The dot product of any two vectors $\ora{a}$ and $\ora{b}$ that have an angle $\theta$ between them is given by $|\ora{a}||\ora{b}|\cos\theta$. Among unit vectors, $\hat i$, $\hat j$ and $\hat k$, % \begin{align} \hat i\cdot\hat j=\hat j\cdot \hat k=\hat k\cdot \hat i&=1\times 1\times \cos \pi/2=0 \\ \hat i\cdot\hat i=\hat j\cdot \hat j=\hat k\cdot \hat k&=1\times 1\times \cos 0=1 \end{align} \\ %text Now consider two vectors $\ora{A}$ and $\ora{B}$ such that, % \begin{align} \ora{A}&=\vector{a_1}{a_2}{a_3} \\ \ora{B}&=\vector{b_1}{b_2}{b_3} \\ \end{align} \\ \begin{align} \ora{A}\cdot\ora{B}&=(\vector{a_1}{a_2}{a_3})\cdot(\vector{b_1}{b_2}{b_3}) \\ &=a_1b_1(\underbrace{\hat i\cdot \hat i}_1)+a_1b_2(\underbrace{\hat i\cdot \hat j}_0)+a_1b_3(\underbrace{\hat i\cdot\hat k}_0) \\ &+\, a_2b_1(\underbrace{\hat j\cdot \hat i}_0)+a_2b_2(\underbrace{\hat j\cdot \hat j}_1)+a_2b_3(\underbrace{\hat j\cdot\hat k}_0) \\ &+\, a_3b_1(\underbrace{\hat k\cdot \hat i}_0)+a_3b_2(\underbrace{\hat k\cdot \hat j}_0)+a_3b_3(\underbrace{\hat k\cdot\hat k}_1) \\ &=a_1b_1+a_2b_2+a_3b_3 \\ \end{align} \\
